comments:
Type rename supports an optional "update similarly named variables and methods" option. This can cause many member name changes. The BreakpointRenameTypeParticipant needs to be updated to handle these changes.

For M4, we disable the breakpoint participant when the option is checked.

Disabled with the following line in our extension definition:

<param name="handlesSimilarDeclarations" value="false"/>

Created an attachment (id=34454)
updates a watch points field

if there is a watchpoint on a field that gets renamed because a class with a similar name got refactored, we want to update the watchpoint's field. Patch works, however it uses an illegal reference to RenameTypeProcessor in order to retrieve the new name of the field.

Tobias,
re: comment #2. What is the proper way to get the new field name (ie without and internal references)?

We have API for that: class IJavaElementMapper/IResourceMapper, available in the plugins org.eclipse.jdt.core.manipulation/org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring. Simply use getAdapter(IJavaElementMapper.class) on the refactoring processor to obtain such a mapper.
